strings


collection of functions to handle strings
naming convention:
- string is a regular C string, char array terminated by null
- bstr is a string block, char array + length
- ctsr works like a C string, in memory is preceded by a header storing the length, capacity of a char array
- ftsr is a fixed cstr created on the stack
- dstr is a dynamically allocated cstr


C_NULL_CHAR

#define C_NULL_CHAR 0
type: C preprocessor definition

C_ENDLINE

#define C_ENDLINE '
'
type: C preprocessor definition

C_NULL_STR

#define C_NULL_STR NULL
type: C preprocessor definition

C_NULL_BSTR

#define C_NULL_BSTR { 0, NULL }
type: C preprocessor definition
description: string block initialization

fstr_struct

#define fstr_struct(name, size) struct { cstr_header header; char text[size + 1]; } name
type: C preprocessor definition
description: declare fixed string in struct

fstr_init

#define fstr_init(size) { { 0, size } }
type: C preprocessor definition
description: initialize fixed string

fstr_name

#define fstr_name(name) CONCAT2(_fixed_string_, name)
type: C preprocessor definition
description: name of fixed string struct when declared on stack

fstr_var

#define fstr_var(name, size) fstr_struct(fstr_name(name), size) = fstr_init(size); memset(fstr_name(name).text, 0, size + 1); fstr name = fstr_name(name).text
type: C preprocessor definition
description: declare & initialize fixed string on the stack

bstr_init

#define bstr_init(text) { sizeof(text) - 1, text }
type: C preprocessor definition
description: initialize a bstr

c_ascii_numerical

bool c_ascii_numerical(char c);
type: C function
description: test if character is between 0 and 9

c_ascii_alphabetical

bool c_ascii_alphabetical(char c);
type: C function
description: test if character is in the alphabet (no accents TODO)

c_ascii_alphabetical_lower

bool c_ascii_alphabetical_lower(char c);
type: C function
description: test if character is between a-z

c_ascii_alphabetical_upper

bool c_ascii_alphabetical_upper(char c);
type: C function
description: test if character is between A-Z

c_ascii_special

bool c_ascii_special(char c);
type: C function
description: test if character is a special characters

type: C function
description: ascii to integer

type: C function
description: ascii to double

bstr

typedef struct {
  size_t length;
  char  *characters;
} bstr;
type: C struct
description: block string, designed to speed up text functions when length is already known

gc_null_bstr

extern const bstr gc_null_bstr;
type: C variable
description: global null bstr

cstr_header

typedef struct {
  size_t length;
  size_t capacity;
} cstr_header;
type: C struct
description: header for cstr type, saves the current length and capacity of the string

cstr

typedef char *cstr;
type: C typedef
description: cstr - C string pointer preceded by header
memory layout: cstr_header | data | terminator

c_cstr_to_bstr

fstr

typedef cstr fstr;
type: C typedef
description: a fixed string is a cstr created on the stack

c_fstr_to_bstr

#define c_fstr_to_bstr  c_cstr_to_bstr

description: define all fstr to cstr func
